pageContext.claim: “We are 5 and 0, as you know, in these special elections. And I think the Democrats thought it would be a lot different than that. 5-0 is a big — that's a big margin.”
pageContext.analysis: There have been five special elections since Trump took office, but the president is overstating his record. Republicans have won four of these elections, all of which took place in districts where the seat was previously held by a Republican. The fifth election was in California's heavily Democratic 34th district, where Xavier Becerra (D-Calif.) appointed California attorney general. He was suceeded by fellow Democrat state Assemblyman Jimmy Gomez.
